result.execSummary:
The defendant Cruz M Mercado was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: If the defendant complies with all the conditions prior to the 1 year, the agent may ask the court to terminate his probation early.

miscConds.notes:
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.

- No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
- No violent contact with the victim.

- Complete Anger Management Class.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cruz M Mercado

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cruz M Mercado in court with attorney Ronald C. Shikora.  Ericka Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Judge Kremers is hearing this case for Judge Havas, who is in trial.
Parties are in court for sentencing.

  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statement/s by: Rebakah
.

Court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 1 year with the following conditions:
- Complete Anger Management Class.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No violent contact with the victim.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at zero.
 
If the defendant complies with all the conditions prior to the 1 year, the agent may ask the court to terminate his probation early.

Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Branch 45 in trial.  Case spun to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1 as Amended:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Court vacates jury trial date of 5-04-2016.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 45.

Defendant Cruz M Mercado in court with attorney Ronald C. Shikora.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for final pretrial.  Parties have reached a resolution.  

 Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 1 amended to Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse Assessments, contrary to Wis. Stats. 947.01(1), 973.055(1), a Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Cruz M Mercado in court with attorney Ronald C. Shikora.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Status of counsel held.  State turned over discovery and will email an offer to defense counsel.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial date.  Case adjourned to Branch 45. 
  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cruz M Mercado in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for status of counsel.  Statements by defendant that he has been looking for an attorney, but has not been able to obtain counsel for financial reasons.  The Court recommends CentroLegal and the Miwaukee Bar Association.  Case adjourned for another status of counsel to Branch 45.   All conditions of bail remain in effect.  Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cruz M Mercado not in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Court contacted defendnat by telephone.  Defendant unable to appear due to illness.  Court orders case adjourned for another status of counsel to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cruz M Mercado in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appearing without counsel.   Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is not eligible for appointment of counsel by court.  Court orders case adjourned for status of counsel to Branch 45. 

Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

16RM006623  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02/07/2016

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Rebekah R. or her minor children and Dawn S.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Cruz M Mercado in court.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Bail Bond Hearing on the NO CONTACT ORDER in Branch 45.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2-9-16 @ 1:30 pm. Bail is set for $200
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
